de.steilerdev.whatToStudy.Utility

Class CSVStreamer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.steilerdev.whatToStudy.Utility.CSVStreamer

  • public class CSVStreamer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class converts a input stream, or a CSV file to be usable by Netica (Respecting Netica Constraints and converting continuous values into discrete ones). The input and output specifications are given by the respective enumeration classes.
    The columns need to be in the following order (Depending on which function is used the 16th and 17th column can be dropped):
    1. Qualification
    2. Qualification average
    3. State
    4. Math
    5. Physics
    6. German
    7. School type
    8. Online test - Math
    9. Online test - German
    10. Study ability test
    11. Age
    12. Sex
    13. Parental income
    14. Nationality
    15. Course
    16. Intermediate Calculation
    17. Final Grade

      static Case getEvaluationCase(java.lang.String inputFile)
      This function reads a file, that contains a case used for evaluation, concluding the 16th and 17th column are not mandatory.
      The values are validated and converted according to the specification stated in the case enumerations and the order is specified within the class description of this class.
      If the are more than one case within the file, only the first case is returned.

    • Method Detail

      • getNeticaStream

        public static norsys.netica.Streamer getNeticaStream(java.lang.String inputFile,
                                                     java.lang.String streamName,
                                                     norsys.netica.Environ env)
                                              throws WhatToStudyException
        This function is converting the file format specified by the exercise, cleans the values and returns a unified Streamer, usable by NeticaJ.
        The first line needs to be a valid header specified within the case enumerations. The order is specified within the class description of this class.
        The values are validated and converted according to the specification stated in the case enumerations and the order is specified within the class description of this class.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - The string representing the path to the input file.
        streamName - The name of the Streamer used by Netica.
        env - The current Environment.
        Returns:
        A Streamer object usable by NeticaJ
        Throws:
        WhatToStudyException - If an error occurs.

      • getNeticaStream

        public static norsys.netica.Streamer getNeticaStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                                     java.lang.String streamName,
                                                     norsys.netica.Environ env)
                                              throws WhatToStudyException
        This function is converting the file format specified by the exercise, cleans the values and returns a unified Streamer, usable by NeticaJ.
        The first line needs to be a valid header specified within the case enumerations. The order is specified within the class description of this class.
        The values are validated and converted according to the specification stated in the case enumerations and the order is specified within the class description of this class.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The input file as stream.
        streamName - The name of the Streamer used by Netica.
        env - The current Environment.
        Returns:
        A Streamer object usable by NeticaJ
        Throws:
        WhatToStudyException - If an error occurs.

      • getCase

        public static Case getCase(java.lang.String caseLine)
                    throws WhatToStudyException
        This function creates a case using the case line. The line needs to have all 17 columns separated by the cvsSplitBy character.
        The values are validated and converted according to the specification stated in the case enumerations and the order is specified within the class description of this class.
        Parameters:
        caseLine - The source line used to create a case.
        Returns:
        The case described inside the case line.
        Throws:
        WhatToStudyException - If an error occurs.

      • getEvaluationCase

        public static Case getEvaluationCase(java.lang.String inputFile)
                              throws WhatToStudyException
        This function reads a file, that contains a case used for evaluation, concluding the 16th and 17th column are not mandatory.
        The values are validated and converted according to the specification stated in the case enumerations and the order is specified within the class description of this class.
        If the are more than one case within the file, only the first case is returned.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - The file name of the source file.
        Returns:
        The Case object storing the evaluation case.
        Throws:
        WhatToStudyException - If an error occurs.
